Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 02:13PM Lenky wrote: Hi, thanks, I had 11 lymph nodes removes too but I have really struggled with the soreness and no-one else seemed to mention this - they talked about pain in the armpit but no problem with skin.    Well I guess I'll just have to keep on with the exercises and tough it out.   I see my onc next week so I will know what chemo and rad treatments I'll be having.     Meantime, I'll shop around for a suitable bra - I've bought several but can't wear any of them for any length of time.   Not helped by having a solitary 36DD swinging free and  on my right hand side either!!!    I know God has been such a strength to me through the last few weeks and that He will continue to do so and I thank Him for support groups like this too.    Thanx again.  luv xx
Posts.Title: sore skin after mastectomy Lenky Lenky

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 02:19PM Lenky wrote: Thank you - I love the dog - she looks so cute.    Thanks for the advice too.    I had 11 lymph nodes removed too but thought as the numbness was wearing off the skin problem should be improving too.   I'm probably just too impatient.    I see my onc next week and will know what and how long my chemo and rad treatment will be.   I have looked at some hats, scarfs, and wigs on the net - the best ones are definitely in the USA but I'll have a look here in the UK first.  I will try and find a bra that works - it isn't really an answer to have one rather large boob living an unfettered life for long.   It makes it easier knowing other people have had the same problem.    I do thank God for all His care of me and for people like you on sites like this.   Take care  luv xxx

Posts.Content: Lenky wrote: Hi everyone,    I need HELP.   I'm having problems after my mastectomy (April 23rd) - I have good movement and am now sleeping quite well and can drive short distances, but feel that the pain under my arm and side is holding me back.      I can't wear a bra for any time at all.   Even wearing sleeveless tops causes problems around the armholes.    It feels like rubbing sandpaper across my skin and it's so sore.     I have started a wider range of exercises the last couple of days and I think it is starting to help but - still no bra.    I can feel the swelling on my arm catching against the swelling on my side.    I'm wondering if that is because I had an expander put in at the same time as my op plus 200ml of fluid (so I have a kind of pocket where my breast used to be) - plus the fact that I'm left handed and lost my left breast.      Has anyone had this problem and what helped you through it?     Thank xx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: sore skin after mastectomy Lenky Lenky
